author: ate
msg: Fixing a very obscure problem when using PostgreSQL (with default UTF-8 encoding)
The PersistenceBrokerSSOProvider uses xor to scramble passwords which can result in UTF-8 0x00 characters.
Java uses a non-standard UTF-8 encoding which can lead to:
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00
Solved by encoding the resulting xored password in Base64
Now finally all testcases work with PostgreSQL again
